Understate: The claim may understate the fact that members of Congress are required to purchase their health insurance from the new exchanges under Obamacare.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it is contradicted by statements from experts and politicians who state that members of Congress will indeed have to buy their health insurance from the exchanges.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that members of Congress are exempt from purchasing health insurance through the exchanges, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation presented in the expert's verdict, which suggests that members of Congress and their staffs are already covered by the same health insurance plans that cover other federal employees, so they wouldn't have needed to buy their insurance through an exchange.
